content.metaTitle: Bo i La Zenia 2026 | Nybyggda hem på Costa Blanca
content.metaDescription: Complete guide to living in La Zenia, Orihuela Costa. Blue Flag beaches, La Zenia Boulevard shopping, golf courses nearby. New build properties from €189,000.
content.heroIntro:
La Zenia is the vibrant heart of Orihuela Costa, where beach lifestyle meets world-class shopping. This sought-after coastal community on Costa Blanca South offers the perfect combination of golden beaches, modern amenities, and a thriving international community.

Located between Cabo Roig and Playa Flamenca, La Zenia has grown from a quiet beach settlement into one of the most desirable addresses on the southern Costa Blanca. The opening of La Zenia Boulevard—Europe's largest open-air shopping center—transformed the area into a destination that attracts both permanent residents and holidaymakers year-round.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Life in La Zenia revolves around the beach and the Boulevard. Start your morning with a coffee at one of the beachfront chiringuitos, spend the afternoon shopping at the Boulevard, and end the day watching the sunset over the Mediterranean. It's a lifestyle that draws people from across Europe.

The area has a strong international community, predominantly British but increasingly Scandinavian and Dutch. English is spoken everywhere, and integrating into local life is effortless through golf clubs, social groups, and the natural meeting points of beach and shopping.
highlights: Blue Flag Playa de La Zenia with golden sand and calm waters
La Zenia Boulevard - 150+ stores, cinema, and 30+ restaurants
Walking distance to beach from most properties
6 golf courses within 15 minutes
Large international expat community
Weekly Saturday market for fresh produce
Year-round mild climate - 320+ sunny days
Excellent bus links along the coast

amenitiesSection.beaches: Playa de La Zenia is the jewel of the area—a wide stretch of golden sand with Blue Flag status, lifeguards in season, beach bars (chiringuitos), sun loungers for hire, and wheelchair access. The calm, shallow waters make it perfect for families. Just north, Cala Bosque offers a quieter alternative, while Cala Capitán to the south provides rocky coves ideal for snorkeling.
amenitiesSection.dining: From traditional Spanish tapas to international cuisine, La Zenia caters to all tastes. The Boulevard alone has over 30 restaurants including Italian, Indian, Chinese, and American options. For authentic Spanish dining, the beachfront chiringuitos serve fresh grilled fish, paella, and cold beer with a view. The nearby Cabo Roig strip offers more upscale dining options.
amenitiesSection.shopping: La Zenia Boulevard is a destination in itself—over 150 stores including Primark, Zara, H&M, Media Markt, Apple reseller, Mercadona supermarket, and Cinesa multiplex cinema. It's one of Europe's largest open-air shopping centers and draws visitors from across the region. For daily essentials, smaller local supermarkets and pharmacies are within walking distance of most properties.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: Hospital Universitario de Torrevieja is just 8 km away (10 minutes by car), with comprehensive services including emergency care, specialists, and English-speaking staff. Multiple private medical centers, dental clinics, and 24-hour pharmacies serve the area. The international community means healthcare services are well-adapted to foreign patients.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante Airport is 50 km away (35 minutes via the AP-7 toll motorway or 50 minutes via the free N-332). Murcia-Corvera Airport is 35 km (30 minutes). Local buses connect La Zenia to Torrevieja, Cartagena, and other coastal towns. However, a car is recommended for maximum convenience. Taxis and ride-sharing are readily available.

content.propertyMarketSection:
La Zenia offers excellent value for beachside living on Costa Blanca South. New build apartments typically range from €189,000-350,000, townhouses from €250,000-450,000, and villas from €400,000-650,000. Properties within walking distance of the beach or Boulevard command premium prices.

The rental market is particularly strong here—the combination of beach, shopping, and golf attracts holiday lets year-round. Properties with pools, air conditioning, and parking achieve the highest yields. Many buyers purchase as holiday homes with rental income, gradually transitioning to permanent residence.

New developments continue to appear, offering modern specifications including communal pools, underground parking, and energy-efficient design. Resale properties are also available for those seeking immediate occupation or larger plots.

neighborhoods.name: La Zenia Beachfront
neighborhoods.description: Premium location within 500m of the beach. Mix of apartments and townhouses. Highest prices but unbeatable convenience.

neighborhoods.name: Boulevard Area
neighborhoods.description: Properties near La Zenia Boulevard. Great for shopping access but slightly further from beach. Excellent rental potential.

neighborhoods.name: La Zenia Mar
neighborhoods.description: Established urbanization with mix of property types. Good community feel with local shops and restaurants.

neighborhoods.name: Towards Playa Flamenca
neighborhoods.description: Slightly lower prices, still walking distance to beach. Family-friendly with good schools nearby.

whyLiveHereSection: Blue Flag beach within walking distance of most properties
La Zenia Boulevard shopping on your doorstep—never need to drive far
Strong international community making integration easy
Excellent rental potential for holiday investment
Six championship golf courses within 15 minutes
Year-round mild climate with 320+ sunny days
More affordable than Costa Blanca North with similar lifestyle

faqs.question: Hur långt är La Zenia-stranden från La Zenia Boulevard?
faqs.answer: La Zenia-stranden ligger ungefär 1 km (10-15 minuters gång) från La Zenia Boulevard. De flesta fastigheter i området ligger inom gångavstånd från båda, vilket gör det lätt att kombinera strandtagar med shopping och matlagning.

faqs.question: Är La Zenia bra för semesteruthyrning?
faqs.answer: Ja, La Zenia är utmärkt för semesteruthyrning. Kombinationen av strand, shopping på Boulevard och närliggande golfbanor skapar året-runt-efterfrågan. Fastigheter med pooler, luftkonditionering och parkering fungerar bäst. Området lockar besökare från hela Europa, vilket säkerställ beläggning bortom bara sommarmånader.

faqs.question: Vad är skillnaden mellan La Zenia och Cabo Roig?
faqs.answer: La Zenia är mer kommersiell och modern, centrerad omkring Boulevard shoppingcenter och strand. Cabo Roig har en mer traditionell spansk känsla med sin charmiga hamn, steniga vikar och lördagsmarknad. Cabo Roig är något mer upmarked. De är intilliggande områden, så du kan enkelt njuta av båda.

faqs.question: Finns det goda restauranger i La Zenia?
faqs.answer: La Zenia Boulevard ensamt har över 30 restauranger som täcker internationella cuisiner. Strandkanten har traditionella spanska chiringuitos. För fin matlagning erbjuder närliggande Cabo Roig upmarkeedalternativ. Du kommer aldrig att sluta på placerats att äta.

faqs.question: Talas engelska omfattande i La Zenia?
faqs.answer: Ja, engelska talar mycket omfattande i La Zenia på grund av den stora brittiska communityn. De flesta butiker, restauranger och tjänster vänder sig till engelsktalare. Många företag är brittiska. Du kan leva bekvämt utan att tala spanska, även om man kan lära sig något alltid uppskattas.

faqs.question: Vilka är fastighetspriser i La Zenia?
faqs.answer: Nybyggda lägenheter startar från omkring €189 000, radhus från €250 000 och villor från €400 000. Strandfront- och Boulevard-angränsande fastigheter kräver premier på 15-25%. La Zenia erbjuder utmärkt värde jämfört med motsvarande lägen på Costa Blanca Nord.

faqs.question: Är La Zenia trafikerad året runt?
faqs.answer: La Zenia har en permanent bosatt befolkning som håller området levande året runt. Sommaren är naturligt mest trafikerad med turister, men Boulevard och golfbanor säkerställ aktivitet året runt. Det milda klimatet (genomsnitt 16-18°C på vintern) betyder att utomhusmatlagning och strandpromenader är möjliga året runt.

faqs.question: Hur långt är närmaste sjukhus från La Zenia?
faqs.answer: Hospital Universitario de Torrevieja ligger 8 km bort (10 minuters körning). Det är ett modernt offentligt sjukhus med nödtjänster och engelsktalande personal. Flera privata kliniker och 24-timmarsfarmackor ligger inom La Zenia själv.

faqs.question: Kan jag gå till allt i La Zenia?
faqs.answer: Ja, de flesta av La Zenia är gångvänligt. Stranden, Boulevard, supermarknader, restauranger och lokala tjänster ligger alla inom gångavstånd från de flesta fastigheter. En bil är dock användbar för golf, att utforska andra områden och flygplats körningar. Många invånare använder cyklar eller el-sparkbilar för lokala resor.

faqs.question: Är La Zenia lämpligt för familjer?
faqs.answer: Absolut. De lugna strandvattnen, familjevänliga restauranger på Boulevard, biograf och säkra bostadsområden gör La Zenia idealisk för familjer. Internationella skolor ligger inom 15-20 minuter, och sjukvården är utmärkt. Communityn har många familjer med barn i alla åldrar.

content.conclusion: Redo att utforska nybyggda fastigheter i La Zenia? Vårt team specialiserar sig på att hjälpa internationella köpare hitta sitt perfekta hem i denna eftersökta strand- och shoppingdestination. Oavsett om du söker en semesterlägenhet med hyrespotential, ett familjeradhus eller ett permanent hem i solen, vägleder vi dig genom varje steg.

investmentAnalysis.overview: La Zenia represents one of Costa Blanca's highest-yielding investment locations. The combination of Blue Flag beach, Europe's largest shopping mall, and proximity to golf courses creates unmatched demand diversity. Properties achieve exceptional occupancy rates throughout the year from both tourist and permanent resident markets.
highlights: Highest rental yields on Costa Blanca from multiple demand sources
Year-round occupancy from beach holidays, shopping visits, and golf
Beach-adjacent properties command premium rental rates
La Zenia Boulevard drives consistent visitor flow to the area
Established track record of strong capital appreciation

costOfLiving.intro: Living in La Zenia offers excellent value for beachside resort living, with costs similar to other established coastal areas but offset by rental income potential for investment properties.

items.notes: Mercadona at La Zenia Boulevard; local shops; weekly markets nearby
Sea breeze reduces cooling; electricity higher in peak summer
Higher for beachfront; includes pool, maintenance, security
Beachfront properties significantly higher due to location value
Beach club memberships, water sports, sun lounger rentals
Cinema, restaurants, entertainment at La Zenia Boulevard
Most areas walkable; car useful for flexibility and golf

expatCommunity.intro: La Zenia has one of Costa Blanca's most established and welcoming expatriate communities. The area attracts families, retirees, and holiday homeowners, primarily from the UK but increasingly diverse. English is spoken everywhere, and the infrastructure for expatriate life is comprehensive. Community integration is easy through shared interests in beach, shopping, and golf.
highlights: Large, established British community with strong support networks
English spoken in nearly all shops, restaurants, and services
Family-friendly atmosphere with schools and child-oriented amenities
Strong beach and sports clubs with regular social activities
Shopping at La Zenia Boulevard creates natural meeting points
Golf clubs serve as important social hubs
International community increasingly diverse beyond British
Numerous expat-oriented social groups and clubs

lifestyleTimeline.title: A Typical Day in La Zenia

entries.description: Morning stroll along Playa de La Zenia beach before the crowds arrive
Coffee at a beachfront chiringuito watching swimmers and early walkers
Shopping, browsing, or catching up with friends at the vast mall
Lunch at one of 30+ restaurants offering cuisines from around the world
Afternoon beach swimming or relaxation at community pool
Afternoon golf round or water sports activity like paddleboarding
Evening promenade walk with aperitivo drinks watching sunset
Dinner at favorite restaurant then cinema or evening entertainment

schema.name: La Zenia
schema.description: La Zenia is a sought-after coastal community in Orihuela Costa, Costa Blanca South, known for its Blue Flag beach, La Zenia Boulevard shopping center, and excellent golf access.

mainEntity.name: How far is La Zenia beach from La Zenia Boulevard?

acceptedAnswer.text: La Zenia beach is approximately 1 km (10-15 minute walk) from La Zenia Boulevard. Most properties are within walking distance of both.

mainEntity.name: Is La Zenia good for holiday rentals?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, La Zenia is excellent for holiday rentals with year-round demand from beach, shopping, and golf visitors.

mainEntity.name: What are property prices like in La Zenia?

acceptedAnswer.text: New build apartments start from around €189,000, townhouses from €250,000, and villas from €400,000. Excellent value compared to Costa Blanca North.

mainEntity.name: Is English widely spoken in La Zenia?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, English is very widely spoken due to the large British community. Most businesses cater to English speakers.

mainEntity.name: Is La Zenia suitable for families?

acceptedAnswer.text: Absolutely. Calm beach waters, family restaurants, cinema, safe residential areas, and nearby international schools make it ideal for families.
